results.title: Focus on India
results.brief_description: An outline of some of the difficulties facing India’s new rulers and the progress being made in many branches of her economy. Among the topics discussed and illustrated are the plans whereby India is attempting to stamp out illiteracy; the attempts being made to weld the many different sects and castes into a single nation; the development of new agricultural and industrial projects.

results.title: Focus on Heroin
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: This film points out the risks of being a heroin addict. Explains that addicts cannot be identified solely with one particular socio-economic level and cannot always be detected by appearance. Addicts and ex-addicts describe the first and subsequent drugs they used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited

results.title: Natural Glass
results.creator_credit: John King, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Looks at a one-man revival of “natural” glass-making in New Zealand, contrasting the delicacies of glass making by one man with his normal job as a worker in a natural gas field.

results.title: Focus on flying boats
results.brief_description: A history of the development of the flying boat, culminating in the production of the 140-ton jet-propelled Saunders-Roe Princess.

results.title: Flying veterinary service
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the flying veterinary service established at Broken Hill by the New South Wales Department of Agriculture. Stresses the importance of the service in the national economy. Shows the work of a veterinary officer as he attends to a case of sheep poisoning.
results.description: Describes the work of the flying veterinary service established at Broken Hill by the New South Wales Department of Agriculture. Stresses the importance of the service in the national economy. Shows the work of a veterinary officer as he attends to a case of sheep poisoning.

results.title: Outdoor adventure: flying squirrels
results.creator_credit: William Horne, Keith Hutchison and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a pet flying squirrel, also known as a sugar glider or phalanger, and features several flights of this marsupial. Describes its diet of nuts, nectar and various insects and shows the trees where it lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Horne, Keith Hutchison and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Flying seeds
results.brief_description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.
results.description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.

results.title: Flying menace
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the life cycle of the fruit fly, and the destruction it causes among Australian fruit. Illustrates the precautions being taken by the Department of Agriculture in checking the spread of the menace and shows how farmers should destroy contaminated fruit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Flying man
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film in which one man flies and another man, in an attempt to imitate him, fails. Uses water colors. Story by Stan Hayward and music by Ron Goodwin. (Award: Grand Prix, Annecy Festival, 1963)

results.title: Flying doctor
results.brief_description: A factual film of a unique Australian service: “By aeroplane and radio the Flying Doctor Service and the Commonwealth Air Ambulance Service bring medical aid to the thinly populated areas of Australia’s vast inland. At Broken Hill base, where this film as photographed, Dr John Wood cares for patients in an area of over 500,000 square miles”. Photography by Lionel Trainor.
